featured.text: An amplified voice of a human was used instead, while the listeners watched the robot.
Because they hear more, good listeners (22) to know more and to be more sensitive to what is going on around them than other people.
In addition, good listeners are inclined to accept or tolerate (23) to judge and criticize.
For example, John Steinbeck is (27) to have been an excellent listener, yet he was hated by some of the people he wrote about.
Thus, (30) on what a good listener does, he may become either popular or disliked in his lifetime.

definition.en_def: A person who listens, especially to someone speaking.
definition.example: She is a great listener and always pays attention to my problems.
